programme.title: The Bill

programme.desc: A gang stealing catalytic converters pick the wrong street to steal from. A takeaway owner faces a gunman and police hunting a fugitive get unexpected help from a herd of cows

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer

programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the show from Gloucester and visits the UK's only Grade II-listed model village, while experts Charles Hanson and Nick Hall assist the red and blue teams

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Sheffield United v Tottenham Hotspur (Kick-off 7.55pm). Gary Lineker presents all the action from the fifth-round tie at Bramall Lane. The Blades nearly succumbed to an upset in the previous round, but eventually defeated National League Wrexham after a replay, and now they are looking for a shock result of their own. Spurs are aiming for their first triumph in this competition since 1991 and recorded a 3-0 win away to another Championship side in Preston North End in the previous round. With analysis from Alan Shearer, Jermaine Jenas and Chris Wilder

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Captain America: The Winter Soldier (2014)
programme.desc: The superhuman soldier becomes an operative for secret intelligence agency SHIELD, but grows suspicious of their motives. Following a battle with a mysterious cyborg assassin, he and fellow Avenger Black Widow become fugitives, and try to bring down a sinister conspiracy. Comic-book thriller sequel, starring Chris Evans, Scarlett Johansson, Samuel L Jackson and Robert Redford

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The candidates embark on a mission to sell and run immersive tours in Shropshire, tasked to sell tickets, book entertainment and organise food and drink. One team deals with confused convicts, while the opposing side narrowly avoids a dining disaster. In the boardroom there's no escape, as one candidate is dismissed at the hands of Lord Sugar

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: An elderly woman wakes up to find a burglar right by her bed, a family run pub discovers its new manager has a sinister secret, and a delivery driver angers the public by apparently stealing a child's ball. Presented by Dominic Littlewood

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A film on social media of a paragliding holidaymaker puts an end to his personal injury claim and the fraud inspectors blow the whistle on a claim for stolen model steam engines. Presented by Naga Munchetty

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The presenters visit two London properties - a two-bedroom flat in Welling and a large Victorian house in Wimbledon - as well as a semi-detached house in Kidsgrove, Staffordshire

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from the Royal Cornwall Showground in Wadebridge as Thomas Forrester and Tim Weeks help two teams look for items to sell at auction in Plymouth

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Kirsty does her best to protect Ollie but wonders if it will be enough. Daniel and Zara learn more about Nina's plans and Jimmi helps a young cricket star face her problems

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Farming duo Ian and Luke are passionate about producing high quality meat, and a vital lifeline for selling it is Guildford Farmers' Market in Surrey. Ian's keen to use his hospitality background, attracting customers with cooking advice, and hopes that the warm weather will bring out the barbecuing buyers. This market is also important for John, a third-generation Sussex fruit farmer. As well as picking his finest fresh fruit, he also makes apple juice so he can pocket as many sales as possible. With over 1,000 potential customers expected, the farmers hope it will prove to be a lucrative day. Narrated by Denis Lawson

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a young and expanding family to escape the city and find some space and tranquillity in the Hampshire countryside with their healthy ¬£800,000 budget. Away from the house hunt, Ginny explores the county's rich maritime heritage on board the armoured battleship HMS Warrior, the pride of Queen Victoria's fleet

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Irita Marriott and Mark Hill go treasure hunting in The Fens. Mark falls head over heels for a very stylish, and shiny, mid-century kitchen appliance, while Irita uncovers something so gold, garish and gaudy it may not sell at auction. They also find a collectable with a very grisly and gruesome history

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Work colleagues Lucy, Fiona, Shannon and Janet compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.desc: Lola and Jay return from their honeymoon and separately seek help for their money issues. Nish and Suki argue over Mitch ahead of their marriage blessing ceremony. Denise and Jack are horrified to learn that Amy has overheard Ravi's promiscuous behaviour whilst at Nugget's house

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Two brothers give investors Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett petrol head vibes as they ride into the Den with their motorcycle clothing brand. Also hoping to rev up the Dragons desire to invest is a matcha-based energy drink company and the entrepreneur behind an inclusive nail polish brand. However, there's competition for cash from a DIY tool that promises to provide measurements like no other and a multipurpose keyring. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The candidates design a new men's skincare product, before pitching it to industry buyers. For one team, wrangling over a recipe leads to a disastrous skin-staining goo, while a lack of creativity on the other side results in an unoriginal concept. Unoriginal concoctions and disastrous recipes almost inevitably lead to a lack of sales. Later, in the boardroom, Lord Sugar is tempted to go beyond his usual single sacking

programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts the satirical quiz, as writer and presenter Richard Osman and Observer columnist Sonia Sodha join regulars Ian Hislop and Paul Merton as they delve into the news headlines of April 2022

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Dealers Irita Marriot and Mark Hill set out on their first trip together. Irita buys a very rare tea-set, while Mark invests in mid-century Italian ceramics

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Go Local
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King go in search of great Yorkshire produce for vegetarian Indian restaurant Prashad in Drighlington on the outskirts of Leeds, coming away with mushrooms, rhubarbs and beetroots. They then make garlic mushroom pakoras, beetroot-stuffed paratha and rhubarb, rose and cardamom kulfi. Willl the restaurant owners be impressed by the ingredients?

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman appeals on behalf of Roald Dahl's Marvellous Children's Charity, which funds specialist nurses to help seriously ill children and support their families in the UK

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Holding Back the Years
programme.desc: Featuring a 101-year-old man who suffered a horrific burglary and Dr Rangan Chatterjee visits Planet of the Vapes to see if e-cigarettes should be available on the NHS

programme.title: Big Cats
programme.desc: The second documentary looks at how cats have adapted to the challenges of life in almost every environment on Earth. The margay leaps through the treetops in the Central American jungle, while the pregnant jaguar waits for thousands of turtles to arrive on a remote Pacific beach. In the Karoo region of South Africa, a tiny black-footed cat stakes its claim to the title of the world's deadliest feline, and in Outer Mongolia, the Pallas's cat is able to disguise itself as a rock - a useful trick while hunting

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: Contestants from Sussex and Northamptonshire take part in the antiques challenge, presented by Paul Martin. The pair are shown the tricks of the trade before an auction showdown

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nihal Arthanayake, Jake Humphrey, Patsy Kensit and Mae Martin go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: Cargo in a British port grinds to a halt when a tugboat picks up a mystery object in its propeller. The divers respond to a callout to get the tug moving again, and end up using everything at their disposal - even a kitchen knife - in an attempt to free the propeller from whatever has been dumped in the river

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: The crew at Tower, on the River Thames in London, is the busiest of all the lifeboat stations, averaging more than 500 shouts a year and aiming to launch to any emergency in under 90 seconds. When a call comes in about a man in the water near the Thames Barrier, they reach him with just moments to spare. In Fleetwood, on the Lancashire coast, a desperate 999 call alerts the crew to a bait digger - out looking for worms on the sand flats - who has been caught out by the incoming spring tide and is in danger of being submerged and swept out to sea

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Scotland serve up their canapes, starters and fish dishes on an animation and illustration theme. The vegan starters includes a posh prison porridge inspired by the time Dennis the Menace's mischief landed him behind bars and a celebration of Bananaman using plantain three ways. The fish course, meanwhile, includes a delicately barbecued salmon belly with a caramelized whey sauce and bilberry gel, inspired by a scene in Disney's Brave, while another chef has fun with celebrated Scottish comic strip Oor Wullie, creating a scallop and crab lasagne bucket with a shellfish bisque and stuffed razor clam

programme.title: The Mormons Are Coming
programme.desc: Following three young missionaries through training, as they give up their names and become Elders and Sisters who live under a strict time table with limited contact with family, will any of them go the distance? This documentary brings a unique insight into who the Mormons are from young believers who are passionate about their faith

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: A selection of the best moments from the T series, hosted by Sandi Toksvig with regular panellist Alan Davies

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Faisal Islam

programme.title: Parole
programme.desc: The parole board considers the cases of two serious offenders. Fifteen years ago, Matthew violently murdered a young woman on a public street. A recently converted Christian, he now has the chance to move to an open prison where he will come into contact with the public. After being convicted for arson, 26-year-old Simran was caught dealing class A drugs. Halfway through his four-and-a-half year sentence, he has the chance to be released into the community. Will his history of mental health problems compromise this opportunity?

programme.title: The Warship: Tour of Duty
programme.desc: After six months at sea on its first operational deployment, HMS Queen Elizabeth departs the Pacific for the long voyage home. After crossing the Arabian Sea, the ship stops at Duqm in Oman to replenish stores, before proceeding up the Red Sea, through the Suez canal and into the eastern Mediterranean. An F35 jet on a routine launch loses power at a critical moment and the pilot has to eject, and HMS Queen Elizabeth launches a search and rescue mission to locate the airman

programme.title: Tokyo Vice
programme.desc: With few other options, Samantha decides to risk everything to get Polina back safely. Jake receives a threatening visit from Tozawa's men, and the message is clear - stay away. But Katagiri has a plan to deal with Tozawa

programme.title: Surgeons: At the Edge of Life
programme.desc: The Addenbrooke's trauma surgeons take two patients from resus to the operating theatre to give them life-saving treatment. The first is 55-year-old Carolyn, who has been involved in a road traffic accident. Despite a cerebral bleed, her most critical injuries are to her pelvis and her heel, which has an open fracture. Meanwhile, 75-year-old Joan has been knocked over by a van, leaving her with multiple injuries. The main question is whether her foot, which has lost a lot of skin, can be saved

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden purchases two dilapidated apartments nestled in the sun-kissed hills of rural Sicily, intending to raise them from their ruins and create luxury holiday homes. The hope is that she and workmate friend Alan Carr to make a huge profit they can donate to charity. After arriving at the crumbling property for the first time, the piles of rubbish and abandoned junk suggest to both that that this visit will be no holiday

programme.title: Holding Back the Years
programme.desc: The team is in Belfast, meeting the woman who could not call 999 after falling because her phone company had cut her off. Fiona Phillips asks whether there are enough public loos

programme.title: Big Cats
programme.desc: The final documentary focuses on the scientists who are studying wild cats in more detail than ever before - and the ground-breaking discoveries they are making. Professor Alan Wilson has been researching the cheetah, using hi-tech collars to rewrite what is understood about the fastest animal on land - revealing that its speed is not its greatest weapon. There is also a look at cat conservation, with stories including that of the Iberian lynx. Just five years ago this was considered the rarest cat on the planet. Now, thanks to a captive breeding programme, numbers are increasing in the wild

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: Paul Martin teaches would-be antiques dealers the tricks of the trade, pitching Pauline Oldford from Telford against Peter Gibbons from Bedfordshire, before an auction showdown

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Antique experts Elizabeth Talbot and Philip Serrell are at Tilbury Docks in Essex in search of items to take off to auction, while presenter Paul Martin uncovers the history of Britain's biggest gunpowder factory.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nihal Arthanayake, Jake Humphrey, Patsy Kensit and Mae Martin go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: Team members inspect an oil tanker the size of two football pitches, which must be examined inch by inch before it is allowed to set sail. With the potential to carry enough crude oil to power a third of the country for a day it is vital they do not miss anything that could mean a disaster in the event of a spillage. Meanwhile, a second team is called out to repair a vital piece of equipment on a cargo ferry that is holding up the transport of vital supplies to a nearby island

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: In Trearddur Bay, the RNLI crew battle through gale force winds and huge waves as they try to save a surfer, as their worried families watch on from the shore. On the same stretch of Welsh coast, the Llandudno and Rhyl lifeboats are involved in a desperate search for a fishing vessel that's reported missing

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The Scottish chefs serve up their mains and desserts, with two of them taking inspiration from The Wind in the Willows by Edinburgh-born Kenneth Grahame. The first prepares a picnic of enticing morsels including cold chicken, beef cheek and spiced aubergine tart, washed down with ginger beer, while the other transports the chefs to Badger's sett with a candlelight dinner of lamb rack, fresh brioche stuffed with lamb stew, smoked yoghurt and pickled elderberry sauce. Meanwhile, the third pays homage to Desperate Dan and his favourite food of cow pie in a refined beef cheek pie with onion crumb puff pastry and glazed vegetables. Which one will impress the judges the most?

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Documentary following doctors and surgeons working for Leeds Hospitals Trust as they decide who to treat next on their ever-increasing waiting lists. At Leeds General Infirmary, Professor Simon Kay stands ready to perform a rare double hand transplant, while in neurosurgery Kenan Deniz has two patients needing urgent brain operations

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.desc: At the mercy of Chauncy and the British, Stede and Blackbeard renounce their pirating ways in a desperate attempt to escape execution

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events. With Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Entebbe (2018)
programme.desc: Fact-based thriller inspired by the 1976 hijacking of a plane by terrorists, chronicling negotiations for the release of the hostages on board and the ultimate decision to send in a crack force of Israeli commandos. Starring Daniel Bruhl, Rosamund Pike and Eddie Marsan

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: A new BSL commentator for live sport, a group translating the Bible into BSL and an investigation into problems with alcohol misuse. With voiceover

programme.title: Saved and Remade
programme.desc: A much-loved childhood bike and a wartime Royal Navy kit bag are among the items transformed by the skilled team of crafters into new and useful items for their owners. Sabrina Grant hosts

programme.title: Putin vs the West
programme.desc: A look at how Western leaders try to enlist Vladimir Putin as peacemaker in the Middle East, but the Russian president instead showed just how far he was willing to go to keep his allies in power. David Cameron recalls the lengths he went to bring Putin closer to the West and how for a while it looked like he might succeed until he backed his ally Bashar al-Assad in the Syrian president's battle to hold onto power in his country's bloody civil war, sending in Russian troops to help him

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Documentary in which reality star and TV presenter Scarlett Moffatt sets out to finally pass her driving test - on the 14th attempt - and also helps other luckless would-be drivers who, like her, have been learning for decades. First up is 25-year-old Jess, who has clocked up hundreds of hours of lessons over eight years. Some instructors will no longer get in a car with her, so stepdad Richard is her last chance as she tackles the five-day course at Scarlett's driving school

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits more archaeological digs around the country, finding out about a gatehouse riddled with Civil War bullets, a unique Iron Age shield made from bark, and Roman burials with pots where the heads should be

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: Baby hippo Mafuta is in crisis. His pod has been taken over by a marauding male and his mother must take him far away from the river. Kali the lioness tries to dig the warthogs out of the den, but there's an unexpected twist when the rest of the pride gets involved. As the land dries, the lake becomes a place of refuge for the thirsty herds - but as things go from bad to worse, Bakari leads the baboons in search of better foraging, while Nalla and the elephants set off in search of water

programme.title: Holding Back the Years
programme.desc: With the NHS apparently moving towards rationing more surgery for chronic conditions, Fiona Phillips and Dr Rangan Chatterjee ask whether having an operation is a person's right. The programme also catches up with the OAP hoarders who are being threatened with eviction and sees what lessons can be learned Japan, which has the longest life expectancy in the world

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Live coverage of day one from Atakoy Arena in Istanbul, Turkey. Heats take place in the men's and women's 800m, women's 3,000m and men's 1500m. In the field, there is qualifying for the men's and women's shot put, women's high jump and men's triple jump

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nihal Arthanayake, Jake Humphrey, Patsy Kensit and Mae Martin test their skills in a variety of trivia-based games, with the ultimate winner declared on Friday

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two highest scoring chefs from Scotland must go head-to-head and cook their six-course menus again. They serve their dishes to the panel of judges, Tom Kerridge, Nisha Katona, Ed Gamble, and celebrated Scottish comic book artist Frank Quitely. Andi Oliver hosts

programme.title: Murder in the Pacific
programme.desc: Documentary examining the May 1985 bombing of Greenpeace ship Rainbow Warrior, a symbol of peace that had just returned from a visit to the Marshall Islands in the Pacific Ocean, where the inhabitants were suffering the effects of nuclear fallout following the 1954 testing of American H-bomb Bravo. After travelling south to Auckland harbour, New Zealand, two explosions sank the ship and killed a crew member

programme.title: Mandy
programme.desc: The hapless heroine examines fatbergs, explainng why there is nothing more shameful for society than their existence. Comedy short, written, directed by and starring Diane Morgan

programme.title: The Apprentice: You're Fired
programme.desc: Tom Allen interviews the show's freshly rejected candidate, who reveals what it is really like to be in the firing line. Studio guests also discuss their views on what has happened in this week's episode

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Slammed: The Seventies
programme.desc: Documentary focusing on the Wales rugby union team in the 1970s. The national rugby team has lost its sparkle and the Welsh Rugby Union puts its faith in a group of talented young players, but with the best team in the world coming to Wales, a radical decision changes their fortunes

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Documentary following doctors and surgeons working for Leeds Hospitals Trust as they decide who to treat next on their ever-increasing waiting lists. At Leeds General Infirmary, Professor Simon Kay stands ready to perform a rare double hand transplant, while in neurosurgery Kenan Deniz has two patients needing urgent brain operations

programme.title: The Warship: Tour of Duty
programme.desc: HMS Queen Elizabeth continues her journey to the South China Sea, but rampant Covid on board means she is not allowed to come ashore for any of the planned port visits. Sailing past Singapore and Hong Kong, the ship has become a floating prison, isolated on the high seas. Her dedicated supply ships do their best to keep the Queen Elizabeth topped up with food, fuel and ammunition. As the QE and her escorting destroyers and frigates enter the contested and potentially dangerous waters of the South China Sea, the Chinese Navy react by probing her with submarines and surface warships. Anti-submarine helicopters launch continually in order to identify, track and see off the subsurface threat

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville report on the heartbreaking case of the woman faced with a large medical bill which her travel insurer will not cover

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Live coverage of the morning session on day two from Atakoy Arena in Istanbul, Turkey. The women's pentathlon gets under way with the 60m hurdles, high jump and shot put. There is also qualifying for the men's long jump and women's pole vault and triple jump, and heats in the men and women's 400m and the women's 1500m and 60m

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels to the steel city of Sheffield where he discovers an early 20th century steam engine which produced armour plates for a Royal Navy warship. Then, Michael heads south into Nottinghamshire and to the former pit village of Eastwood, before arriving in Nantwich, where he takes a dip in the briny

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross demonstrates the creation of the perfect brown-toned scene of a mountain at sunset

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel and Jean spend a nostalgic day in Buckinghamshire reliving their courtship days - but find things have changed in the intervening years. However, certain treasured memories remain. Originally shown in 1992

programme.title: The Mistress
programme.desc: The second series of Carla Lane's love triangle comedy, starring Felicity Kendal, Peter McEnery and Jane Asher. From 1987

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: A chronicle of the English Civil War, revealing that behind the romantic stories of Cavaliers and Roundheads lies a terrible tale of tragedy and the death of innocents. The conflict saw hundreds of thousands of men, women and children killed, families torn apart and the nation divided, culminating in the public execution of King Charles I and the rise of Cromwell as Lord Protector

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: An exploration of the process of filming sex scenes in Hollywood movies, the toll these scenes take on those involved and the impact on women and girls in the real world. The film features candid interviews with actors and film-makers including Jane Fonda, Rosanna Arquette, Joey Soloway, Angela Robinson, Karyn Kusama, Rose McGowan, Alexandra Billings, Emily Meade and David Simon, and highlights the voices of women who have spoken out against abusive behaviour on their sets and were punished for it

programme.title: Africa with Ade Adepitan
programme.desc: Ade explores central Africa, travelling through Gabon, the Democratic Republic of Congo and Uganda. He investigates plans to develop a sustainable version of palm oil farming, meets a champion boxer helping to rehabilitate child soldiers, and talks to one of Africa's most outspoken political campaigners. He also reports on how conflict between militia groups influenced by foreign powers lies at the heart of the problems that have made the Democratic Republic of Congo arguably the most chaotic and corrupt country in Africa, as well as discovering how the conflict has impacted on the country's few remaining gorillas

programme.title: Da Vinci: The Lost Treasure
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce travels to Florence, Milan, Paris and Warsaw to tell the story of Leonardo da Vinci's life, exploring why a man whose reputation rests on only a few pictures - including the Mona Lisa - is regarded as one of the greatest painters of all time. She also visits New York to see a recently discovered piece by the artist

programme.title: Bent Coppers: Crossing the Line of Duty
programme.desc: Documentary examining corruption in the police in the 1970s, revealing a secret network of officers was operating illegally throughout London and led to the formation of the first internal anti-corruption unit A10, which inspired the BBC drama Line of Duty. The story begins in 1969, when a desperate south London criminal tipped off the Times about how he was being extorted for money by a detective in the Metropolitan Police

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: A chronicle of the English Civil War, revealing that behind the romantic stories of Cavaliers and Roundheads lies a terrible tale of tragedy and the death of innocents. The conflict saw hundreds of thousands of men, women and children killed, families torn apart and the nation divided, culminating in the public execution of King Charles I and the rise of Cromwell as Lord Protector

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels between Liverpool and Wales. Along the way he discovers a childhood favourite - a miniature tank engine with three carriages in dark red - made by Frank Hornby, and learns the story of a Welsh countess who lived in Gwrych Castle. In Snowdonia, he also rides the waves with a Welsh surfing champion

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: American artist Bob Ross creates a tranquil landscape, almost feathery in appearance, at the base of a towering mountain

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin marks the 50th anniversary of the construction of the Severn Bridge in a Timeshift special telling the inside story of its design and construction. As the motorway link between England and Wales, the Severn Bridge was described as 'the most perfect suspension bridge in the world', and Liz reveals how its unique, slim-line structure came about by accident

programme.title: Patagonia with Huw Edwards
programme.desc: The newsreader follows in the footsteps of settlers who travelled from Wales to Patagonia 150 years ago with the intention of creating a colony where their language and culture would endure. On arrival in South America, Huw meets descendants of the original immigrants and examines how much of their spirit lives on in the present

programme.title: Edge of Darkness
programme.desc: Craven and Jedburgh follow in Emma's fateful footsteps and enter the nuclear facility of Northmoor, unaware the plant's security staff know they're on the way. Penultimate part of the award-winning thriller, starring Bob Peck

programme.title: Edge of Darkness
programme.desc: Jedburgh obtains the plutonium which proves Northmoor has been running an illegal weapons plant, but he and Craven are exposed to deadly radiation. While waiting to die, they head for an international atomic energy conference for a final confrontation with Grogan. Troy Kennedy Martin's political thriller, starring Bob Peck, Joe Don Baker and Joanne Whalley

programme.title: Peaky Blinders
programme.desc: Tommy sets off to North America, where the end of Prohibition brings opportunities, but he faces new danger from an old adversary who is finally making his move. In his Boston hotel room, Tommy takes a call and receives very concerning news, forcing him to cut short his trip and head straight back to Birmingham. Starring Cillian Murphy, Natasha O'Keeffe, Paul Anderson and Sophie Rundle

programme.title: Peaky Blinders
programme.desc: Tommy gets involved in a power game when a Boston gangster comes to the UK on a fact-finding mission to take the political temperature in Europe - and to find a contact who can put him in touch with Mosley's fascists. As the various parties involved make their plans to double cross him, Tommy visits an old ally in Camden

programme.title: Peaky Blinders
programme.desc: As Ruby is rushed into hospital for urgent treatment for consumption, Tommy is more convinced than ever that his family has been cursed. He sets out on a journey to a gypsy camp to discover who is responsible and how his family might be saved. Ada takes charge of the situation, instructing Arthur to round up some new recruits and head to Liverpool to deliver a warning. Stephen Graham guest stars

programme.title: Peaky Blinders
programme.desc: Tommy and his allies gather in the wake of their recent losses and prepare to seek revenge on their enemies. He is driven to build a connection between crime and political power that could alter the course of history, bringing together an alliance of extremists from both sides of the Atlantic. However, he also receives life-changing news from an unexpected source, that leaves him dreading the prospect of war within the family

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In picturesque Snowdonia, Michael Portillo braves the fastest zip line in the world - stretching 1,500 feet across a vast slate quarry as he begins the last leg of his journey to Caernarfon. En route, he also visits the home of British mountaineering, Pen y Gwryd, to hear how an Edwardian journalist and poet created a climbing community, which grew to include men who would conquer Everest in the 1950s

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson reveals how some of the nation's best-loved villages played a vital part in significant moments of history. He begins in Bamburgh in Northumberland, explaining how the health and fortunes of the village were shaped by those in charge of its famous castle, from early English kings to 18th-century philanthropists, who pioneered a welfare system nearly 200 years before one existed nationally. Ben visits fellow archaeologist Jessica Turner, whose findings show the seventh-century residents of Bamburgh were robust and healthy - contrary to the usual malnourishment of the British medieval population

programme.title: Chariots of Fire (1981)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning drama based on the true story of British runners Eric Liddell and Harold Abrahams, going for gold at the 1924 Olympics in Paris. The two athletes are driven by very different impulses - Liddell is inspired by his devout Christian faith, while Abrahams hopes to triumph over the anti-Semitism he has endured all his life. Starring Ian Charleson, Ben Cross, Nigel Havers, John Gielgud and Ian Holm. Vangelis provides the soundtrack

programme.title: Rain Man (1988)
programme.desc: Brash yuppie car dealer Charlie discovers his deceased father has left the family fortune to Raymond, the autistic elder brother he never knew he had. In a bid to get his hands on the money, he tracks down and abducts Raymond - but the ensuing cross-country journey proves to be a profound learning experience for them both. Oscar-winning drama, starring Tom Cruise and Dustin Hoffman, with Valeria Golino, Gerald R Molen and Jack Murdock

programme.title: Hans Zimmer: Hollywood Rebel
programme.desc: Profile of the Oscar-winning composer responsible for some of the best-loved film and TV scores of the past few decades. Contributors include directors Christopher Nolan, Denis Villeneuve, and Steve McQueen. In this portrait, Zimmer reveals the musical secrets of his craft - how he goes about terrifying, moving and raising people's spirits through his work

programme.desc: The Go Jetters are going to Westman Islands, Iceland, where the world's largest colony of Atlantic puffins gathers every year. Lars loves these tough little birds and explains how, although they spend most of their lives flying out to sea and fishing, they return to land each year to lay their eggs. When the baby birds, also called pufflings, eventually hatch, they fly out towards the ocean. But the light from nearby towns often confuses them about where to go, leading local children and adults to form 'puffin patrols' to rescue the pufflings. After a short stop off at Nana's house, where they make delicious Welsh cakes together, Mollie and her family head over to a local workshop. They get the chance to design their very own lovespoon and watch it actually being made! Before the day is done, it's time to catch the St David's Day festival in Swansea. Mollie gets a chance to take part in lots of fun activities like making dragon wings, spray-painting and trying delicious Welsh food. What an exciting time!

programme.desc: The superhuman soldier becomes an operative for secret intelligence agency SHIELD, but grows suspicious of their motives. Following a battle with a mysterious cyborg assassin, he and fellow Avenger Black Widow become fugitives, and try to bring down a sinister conspiracy. Comic-book thriller sequel, starring Chris Evans, Scarlett Johansson, Samuel L Jackson and Robert Redford

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts the satirical quiz, as writer and presenter Richard Osman and Observer columnist Sonia Sodha join regulars Ian Hislop and Paul Merton as they delve into the news headlines of April 2022

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones hosts the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: Undercover cops pick up an international gang of pickpockets. A couple are stunned to find a stranger in their hallway, and a reckless lorry driver reverses on a motorway into oncoming traffic. Presented by Dominic Littlewood

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A film on social media of a paragliding holidaymaker puts an end to his personal injury claim and the fraud inspectors blow the whistle on a claim for stolen model steam engines. Presented by Naga Munchetty

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The presenters visit two London properties - a two-bedroom flat in Welling and a large Victorian house in Wimbledon - as well as a semi-detached house in Kidsgrove, Staffordshire

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from the Royal Cornwall Showground in Wadebridge as Thomas Forrester and Tim Weeks help two teams look for items to sell at auction in Plymouth

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Kirsty does her best to protect Ollie but wonders if it will be enough. Daniel and Zara learn more about Nina's plans and Jimmi helps a young cricket star face her problems

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Farming duo Ian and Luke are passionate about producing high quality meat, and a vital lifeline for selling it is Guildford Farmers' Market in Surrey. Ian's keen to use his hospitality background, attracting customers with cooking advice, and hopes that the warm weather will bring out the barbecuing buyers. This market is also important for John, a third-generation Sussex fruit farmer. As well as picking his finest fresh fruit, he also makes apple juice so he can pocket as many sales as possible. With over 1,000 potential customers expected, the farmers hope it will prove to be a lucrative day. Narrated by Denis Lawson

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a young and expanding family to escape the city and find some space and tranquillity in the Hampshire countryside with their healthy ¬£800,000 budget. Away from the house hunt, Ginny explores the county's rich maritime heritage on board the armoured battleship HMS Warrior, the pride of Queen Victoria's fleet

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Irita Marriott and Mark Hill go treasure hunting in The Fens. Mark falls head over heels for a very stylish, and shiny, mid-century kitchen appliance, while Irita uncovers something so gold, garish and gaudy it may not sell at auction. They also find a collectable with a very grisly and gruesome history

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Work colleagues Lucy, Fiona, Shannon and Janet compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Lola and Jay return from their honeymoon and separately seek help for their money issues. Nish and Suki argue over Mitch ahead of their marriage blessing ceremony. Denise and Jack are horrified to learn that Amy has overheard Ravi's promiscuous behaviour whilst at Nugget's house

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Two brothers give investors Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett petrol head vibes as they ride into the Den with their motorcycle clothing brand. Also hoping to rev up the Dragons desire to invest is a matcha-based energy drink company and the entrepreneur behind an inclusive nail polish brand. However, there's competition for cash from a DIY tool that promises to provide measurements like no other and a multipurpose keyring. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The candidates design a new men's skincare product, before pitching it to industry buyers. For one team, wrangling over a recipe leads to a disastrous skin-staining goo, while a lack of creativity on the other side results in an unoriginal concept. Unoriginal concoctions and disastrous recipes almost inevitably lead to a lack of sales. Later, in the boardroom, Lord Sugar is tempted to go beyond his usual single sacking

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Sunderland to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: BBC journalists including Adam Fleming and Chris Mason host a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Dark Land: Hunting the Killers
programme.desc: After builders discover a skeleton is discovered wrapped in carpet in a garden in Cardiff, forensic artist Richard Neave was called in to worked with the skull to create a clay bust of what the face may have looked like. Following a TV appeal, the victim was identified, leading the team revisit the case of 15 year-old Karen Price who ran away from care and catch her killer

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Fulham v Leeds United (Kick-off 7.45pm). Gary Lineker presents all the action from the fifth-round tie at Craven Cottage. Goals by Aleksandar Mitrovic, Bobby Decordova-Reid and Willian helped Fulham record a 3-2 win when the sides met in the Premier League at Elland Road in October. They will be hopeful of recording a second victory of the season against United now they have home advantage, but Leeds may see this tie as a welcome distraction from their struggles in the Premier League. With analysis from Micah Richards, Danny Murphy and Jermaine Beckford

programme.title: Rain Man (1988)
programme.desc: Brash yuppie car dealer Charlie discovers his deceased father has left the family fortune to Raymond, the autistic elder brother he never knew he had. In a bid to get his hands on the money, he tracks down and abducts Raymond - but the ensuing cross-country journey proves to be a profound learning experience for them both. Oscar-winning drama, starring Tom Cruise and Dustin Hoffman, with Valeria Golino, Gerald R Molen and Jack Murdock

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Two brothers give investors Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett petrol head vibes as they ride into the Den with their motorcycle clothing brand. Also hoping to rev up the Dragons desire to invest is a matcha-based energy drink company and the entrepreneur behind an inclusive nail polish brand. However, there's competition for cash from a DIY tool that promises to provide measurements like no other and a multipurpose keyring. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The candidates design a new men's skincare product, before pitching it to industry buyers. For one team, wrangling over a recipe leads to a disastrous skin-staining goo, while a lack of creativity on the other side results in an unoriginal concept. Unoriginal concoctions and disastrous recipes almost inevitably lead to a lack of sales. Later, in the boardroom, Lord Sugar is tempted to go beyond his usual single sacking

programme.desc: Iagan MacNeil finds out about the landscape and history along the St Cuthbert's Way, starting off at Melrose Abbey, where he talks to Iain Craig of Historic Environment Scotland. The 62-mile long pilgrims' route - named after the seventh-century hermit, healer and bishop St Cuthbert - links Melrose Abbey in the Scottish Borders where Cuthbert began his religious life, with his original burial place on the Holy Island of Lindisfarne off the Northumbrian coast

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: The bracing sea air of Blackpool is home to David Dickinson and his dealers, where a whole cast of character jugs has new dealer Matt on his toes, an old train set surprises everyone at auction and Jan Keyne misses out big time when a forgotten book's true value comes to light in an exciting battle of the bidders

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Professional entertainers Nick and Tina, best friends Aaron and Gabriel from Leeds, and Salford-based couple Anna and Ollie try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Presented by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a ¬£10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Debbie, Ian, Joe, and Kirsty pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Bristol City v Manchester City (Kick-off 8.00pm). Laura Woods presents coverage of the fifth-round tie, which comes from Ashton Gate. The Robins have eliminated two fellow Championship sides so far in Swansea City and West Bromwich Albion, but now face arguably the toughest home tie possible against the Citizens. Pep Guardiola's only triumph in this competition was in the 2018/19 season, but hopes will be high of a repeat after they knocked out Premier League title rivals Arsenal in the previous round. With analysis from Roy Keane and Ian Wright, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Ally McCoist

programme.title: Cold Case Forensics
programme.desc: Forensic scientist Dr Angela Gallop and her team detail the methods that helped them crack the 1988 murder of Lynette White in Cardiff. The case had resulted in one of Britain's worst miscarriages of justice, and by 1999 it remained unsolved when a new detective squad brought in Dr Gallop and her forensic team to help solve the case. She and other experts, as well as police officers, lawyers and one of those wrongly accused, tell the story. Nicola Walker narrates

programme.desc: The number of households renting in Britain has doubled in the last two decades. Datshiane Navanayagam looks at the reality facing Britain's renters

programme.title: Life and War: Ukraine a Year On
programme.desc: Twelve months ago, Vladimir Putin shocked the world by launching a full-scale invasion of neighbouring Ukraine. While millions fled abroad, many more stayed to face their invaders. programme.title: World's Funniest Videos
programme.desc: Featuring the top 10 times it was good that there was a barrier. Plus, a bat driving a family batty and an impatient dog which keeps beeping a car horn.

programme.title: Totally Bonkers Guinness World Records
programme.desc: Matt Edmondson narrates more record feats, including the world's longest tongue and the fastest escape from a straitjacket underwater

programme.title: Love Bites
programme.desc: Scarlett Moffatt hosts, as singleton Rashaun chooses to date one of Harley, Naomi and Keelie - not on their looks but their cooking skills. After picking his favourite menu, the cook behind it reveals themselves and joins him for a date

programme.title: Dress to Impress
programme.desc: Three suitors buy an outfit for fashion entrepreneur Caz, who then goes on a date with the person whose taste in clothes they liked best

programme.title: Chuck
programme.desc: The team travels to a Loire Valley vineyard to retrieve a nano-chip that Agent Rosenbaum planted before he died. However, Chuck has other things on his mind as he plans to propose to Sarah, but his gesture is scuppered when she is arrested for treason and hauled off to prison

programme.title: One Tree Hill
programme.desc: Nathan decides to drop in on Taylor after visiting Haley, hoping to take their relationship a stage further. Peyton and Jake do their best to keep baby Jenny a secret from Nicki, and Anna gets a surprise visit from her ex-girlfriend - which tempts her to reveal her sexuality to her parents

programme.title: The O.C.
programme.desc: Caleb proceeds with his plans to adopt Lindsay, but inadvertently upsets her, leaving Ryan to pick up the pieces. Sandy has to choose between an old love and his present life, Marissa gets more involved in her new relationship, and Seth worries that any chance of getting back with Summer may be lost as she prepares to go to Italy with Zach

programme.title: Love Bites
programme.desc: Jack, Darren and Felix all attempt to make a seafood linguine from scratch in order to win a date with 22-year-old Ellie from London

programme.title: Dress to Impress

programme.desc: A white Christmas plunges Aidensfield into chaos, with Nick stranded in Jo's cottage by heavy snow and Ventress caught in an awkward situation while wearing full Santa Claus gear. The police station is also invaded by Greengrass's geese - and a plane carrying a fugitive criminal and his pregnant wife crashes on the moors, leading to a desperate manhunt. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry, Juliette Gruber, William Simons and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: English country squire Marcus Waverly receives a series of anonymous letters threatening to kidnap his son Johnnie, but the case is dismissed by Scotland Yard - prompting Poirot to open his own investigation. Drama, starring David Suchet and Geoffrey Bateman

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Debbie vents her fury at Charity and Cain. Frances seeks Diane's advice, Ollie decides to give Danny more attention and Marlon outstays his welcome

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Chris cannot wait to tell Debbie about Cain's arrest. Marlon returns to the Dingles', Danny comes in for more criticism and Andy asks Robert for a loan

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Janice regrets the previous night's events, but Les cannot seem to wipe the smile off his face. Audrey and Mike are stunned to discover Bet has lost her court case

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Jason returns from Blackpool, Blanche suspects Archie and Audrey are up to something, and Karen seduces Steve in one of the flats, but gets caught by Richard

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A prominent resident is robbed and battered to death with her walking stick, and suspicion soon falls on the members of her reading club - which turns out to be a front for a lucrative investment portfolio. John Nettles and Daniel Casey star, with guest appearances by Anton Rodgers (Fresh Fields) and Angela Thorne (To the Manor Born)

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: The fair arrives in the village and Mrs Hughes finds herself the centre of speculation when she meets a former suitor who makes her question her position at Downton. Meanwhile, Violet and Isobel lock horns over a medical ailment affecting Molesley, and Carson fears there is a thief at work in the grounds. Costume drama, starring Maggie Smith, Hugh Bonneville, Phyllis Logan, Penelope Wilton, Jim Carter and Kevin Doyle

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick and Jo buy an engagement ring, but receive a hostile response to their news from her mother. Greengrass angers Blaketon by standing bail for a burglar. Rural drama, starring Nick Berry, Juliette Gruber and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the discovery of an unidentified teenage boy's body in a coastal town's shipyard, who is revealed to be listed as a missing person, having absconded from the care of his support worker. Vera discovers that the quiet community where he was found is plagued by a serious drugs problem - despite the fact that the only known dealer in the area has turned his back on crime. The victim could be the answer to the mystery, but a wall of silence surrounds his death. Mark Addy guest stars

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: When a young man is found dead and stark naked out on the Fens, Will and Geordie discover ties to a Cambridge research project experimenting with mind-altering drugs. Its arrogant professor is a proponent of the drug LSD in his psychotherapy sessions, but Will and Geordie start wondering whether there is more going on. As the case proceeds, Will's feelings of guilt about his father's death and his conflicted feelings about Ellie start to take their toll. Elsewhere, the Keatings suffer an awkward dinner party and the Chapman feud shows no sign of relenting. Robson Green and Tom Brittney star

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: It's the day of Saif's funeral, and as Jenn watches closely for any suspicious behaviour, divisions within the Rahman household widen. Adnan is anxious about the repercussions of last night's incident, but Jenn's attempts to help are overshadowed by Mariam's reaction to events at the funeral. Back at the station, Clarkie's investigation leads to a significant breakthrough about a possible motive for Saif's murder, which suggests the killer might be connected to the Rahmans. But before Jenn can investigate further, some shocking personal news throws her off course. Crime drama, starring Marsha Thomason

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: David plans a surprise party for Karen's 40th birthday, even though she'd rather not bother, and Anna rekindles her romance with Simon now he's returned from Australia a single man once more. Jess is devastated to receive disappointing A level results, meaning she can't get away from home, and newcomers the Morecroft family arrive in Skelthwaite, hoping to shake off their tragic past

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Stephen is faced with a dilemma when he meets an old flame. Karen and David begin to worry about the whereabouts of Jess, and an elderly patient is distraught when his partner is put into care. Drama following community nurses living and working in a small Yorkshire town, starring Leslie Ash, Phil Middlemiss and Thomas Craig

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A commercial decision to turn Midsomer Deverell's memorial garden into a tea shop proves fatal for members of the Inkpen family. DCI Barnaby's investigation unearths more than mere local hostility as he lifts the lid on long-buried secrets. Anna Calder-Marshall and Margaret Tyzack guest star

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Everyone is anxious at the arrival of Matthew Crawley, the heir presumptive, but he soon encounters problems settling into his new life in Downton, and his mother Isobel immediately crosses swords with Violet. Meanwhile, butler Carson is mortified to be confronted with his past, and housemaid Gwen seems to have a secret correspondent. Costume drama, starring Maggie Smith, Hugh Bonneville, Dan Stevens, Penelope Wilton, Elizabeth McGovern, Jim Carter and Rose Leslie

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick goes undercover to track down an escaped prisoner, Greengrass discovers a couple of naturists, and Auntie Eileen has a decision to make when she meets a face from her past. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry, Bill Maynard and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: DCI Barnaby launches a murder investigation when the severed hand of a missing hotel manager is found by a dog. The dead man had recently been named in the will of the hotel owner, and solving the case takes on a renewed sense of urgency when fatal accidents start happening to the other beneficiaries. Mystery, guest starring Rosemary Leach and Samantha Bond, with John Nettles and Daniel Casey

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: After Will and Leonard witness a deadly and deliberate hit-and-run, Geordie traces the car to a pair of decidedly dysfunctional brothers, whose house lies far off the beaten path. The victim's wife, his employee and the two brothers are all damaged characters caught in a web of lies and betrayals - and it's not just secrets hiding within the siblings' grounds. Back at home, Will and Geordie both struggle as unwelcome guests look set to stay - Will's mum Amelia seems to have found a carbon copy of his late father in her new beau. Meanwhile, a new television set lands in the vicarage - just in time for Eurovision. Robson Green, Tom Brittney and Al Weaver star

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: An obstreperous suspect causes difficulties for the team, until Jenn identifies a key witness who is able to unlock the answers they need. programme.desc: Joe tells Geena why he has been avoiding her, and Richard and Sarah have a heart to heart in an effort to clear the air

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A horse whisperer disappears in Newton Magna, bringing Barnaby face to face with long-standing adversary Melvyn Stockard. The former convict's social climbing has paid dividends, sending him straight to the top of the village pecking order - and some believe his driving ambition makes him capable of foul play. Murder mystery, guest starring Larry Lamb (EastEnders, Gavin & Stacey), with John Nettles and Daniel Casey

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Cora's attempts at matchmaking are dashed when Mary is smitten not by intended target Evelyn Napier, but by his handsome friend, Turkish attache Kemal Pamuk. The couple's mutual attraction sparks a train of events whose consequences ripple through the entire household. Gwen is humiliated as her secret ambition is exposed, and Bates takes extreme action to cure his limp. Costume drama, starring Maggie Smith, Michelle Dockery, Brendan Patricks, Theo James, Rose Leslie and Elizabeth McGovern

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A white Christmas plunges Aidensfield into chaos, with Nick stranded in Jo's cottage by heavy snow and Ventress caught in an awkward situation while wearing full Santa Claus gear. programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Oxford's last-surviving all-female college is holding a reunion to bid farewell to one of its most prominent professors. However, the evening leads to tragedy when a guest is found murdered, and Lewis is convinced the killing is connected to an attack that occurred at the same institution 10 years previously. The detective calls in his former DS, Alison McLennan, to help with the investigation, but the case takes a twist when two more bodies turn up. Crime drama, guest starring Juliet Stevenson and Saskia Reeves, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Will and Ellie go on their first date with a trip to the flicks. However, a scream from the projection booth cuts the romance short as they discover a brutal murder has taken place within the cinema. Geordie arrives to investigate and soon they've found movie star connections, oddball employees and a link to the Asian subcontinent, as a shadowy figure emerges from Jack Chapman's past and refuses to retreat without causing a stir. Cathy's mother takes the children out for the day, which ends up worrying Cathy far more than it should. Robson Green, Tom Brittney, Lauren Carse and Kacey Ainsworth star

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: Several major developments in the case point the team towards suspects in surprising places. programme.desc: The world of marine salvage and rescue in Australia, filmed in the Whitsunday Islands off Queensland

The Seagulls have impressed in the Premier League in the current campaign and thrashed Middlesbrough in round three before eliminating last season's cup-winners Liverpool. He's so strong, so buff, and he's got so many super-cool tattoos - there's no-one like Jason Tattoo! The star of our heroes' favourite action films has the most awesome tattoos... so they think 'What a good idea!' The friends totally need tattoos to be fly, but it's not so easy to get one when you're ten years old, though!

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Magoo has a date with Marnie. He intends to take her to a fun park but ends up in an abandoned factory instead. This spells trouble for Fizz.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. While Abacus is on holiday, Lloyd tries to hang out with PB and her friends Dotty and Freckles instead, but they are far less willing to do what he wants to do than Abacus is, and Lloyd has to adapt to doing what the majority want to do.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. When Mr Wiggley runs out of ideas for his Chrysalist - a list of fun things to do before he becomes a butterfly - Lloyd is happy to help and join in with putting it together, but he starts to suspect that Mr Wiggley is once again putting off pupating.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Betty wants a nice photo of Dave and Anna, but the camera George uses happens to belong to Gran, and it's been cursed by an ancient mummy.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: If there were two things Dave could wish for it would be for Fuzzypeg to smell better, and for Gran to be nicer. Is getting what you want always a good thing?

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: Fred, Daphne, Velma, Shaggy and Scooby-Doo join forces with some of the biggest names in celebrity and pop culture.

programme.title: Buck and Buddy
programme.desc: Buck and Buddy have discovered parkour, and now nothing cans top them from running and jumping all over the place.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: Scooby and the Mystery Inc. gang meet Wanda Sykes, who is helping save a bunch of cute, fuzzy animals up for adoption.

programme.title: Tata and Kuma
programme.desc: Madcap animated comedy. Dr Ding Ding cannot stand the noise that Tata and Kuma make all day long, so he demands that Tata and Kuma leave the flat - when they ignore him, Ding Ding plans to force them to leave by making Room 1004's environment uninhabitable. When Ding Ding makes the floor a fiery hell, Tata and Kuma enjoy the sauna-like effect, and when the doctor freezes the floor to make it feel like Alaska, the pair enjoy skating and eating ice flakes.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Teen Titans Go takes a comedic look at the superheroes' lives. Viewers will finally get the opportunity to watch what life is like for the super teens.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Series that takes a comedic look at the Teen Titans' lives.

programme.title: DC Super Hero Girls
programme.desc: When six ordinary girls meet and discover that they each have extraordinary powers, they decide to join forces to take on one of Metropolis's most sinister villains

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Red Son takes over the Weather Station, a prestigious club that allows its members to control the weather in different parts of the city, in order to restore his father the Demon Bull King back to power - Monkie Kid attempts to defeat Red Son but has a hard time controlling his power, so the Monkey King limits MK's powers so that he can use them effectively until he has time to train and learn to fully control them.

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. After Tang mentions the famed power of the Monkey King to duplicate himself, Monkie Kid decides to create clones so he can stay home and play video games after he has to do a lot of work for his friends - however, he doesn't know how to use his powers, and so the clones wreak havoc...

programme.title: LEGO Marvel Avengers: Climate Conundrum
programme.desc: Animated series based on the Marvel superhero team. The Environmental Clean-Up Conference is off to anything but a smooth start when Tony Stark realises that his fellow competitor is his rival Justin Hammer, but when a mysterious saboteur turns the inventions at the conference against the scientists there, it's up to Iron Man to save the day. At the same time, Captain America finally has a day off but cannot decide what to do with his free time - then the forces of AIM attack...

programme.title: Overlord and the Underwoods
programme.desc: The Underwoods, a normal family, have their lives thrown off kilter when the second most wanted bad guy in the galaxy moves in with them under witness protection

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Game show that sees teenage presenter Danny Murphy take on some of the craziest dares, from rock climbing to racing a hovercraft! In this episode, Danny takes to the water on a surf simulator as he attempts a 360 degree spin!

programme.title: Drop Dead Weird
programme.desc: Comedy drama following the adventures of an Australian family who move to an isolated seaside village in western Ireland, with the parents having a secret to hide

programme.title: Makeaway Takeaway
programme.desc: A comedy arts and crafts show for six to 11-year-olds and presented by comedian Bec Hill. Bec wants to get Makeaway Takeaway into the Big Book of Wacky Records, but can she succeed? She comes up with a winning technique to create the perfect straight line in the process, and a customer calls needing help to stop him and his mates arguing over what to do, resulting in some giant-sized 'Decision Dentures' - Bec also creates a pencil case almost good enough to eat with just three ingredients!

programme.title: Ted's Top Ten
programme.desc: Comedy series following the misadventures of Ted and his friends and family. Ted's keen to make a big impression on his first day of high school, believing he's done just that when he completes an initiation on the school bus by mooning a nearby car, but there's a problem - the driver of the car is deputy head Mr Rodman! Ted, Jai and Cody must now break into that same car to retrieve the incriminating evidence from the dash cam - meanwhile, Jada is busy trying to join an exclusive study group.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.desc: Animated comedy featuring two trouble-making young friends who re-imagine their grumpy headmaster as a superhero looking to fight crime and save their city. Krupp has re-separated George and Harold between the two camps, so the boys 'borrow' Melvin's new machine that makes animals smart and create a super-smart possum named Ragely in order to keep Krupp in line, but Ragely isn't satisfied by merely taking the camps from Krupp - he wants to take over civilisation for the animals!

programme.title: DC Super Hero Girls
programme.desc: When six ordinary girls meet and discover that they each have extraordinary powers, they decide to join forces to take on one of Metropolis's most sinister villains

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mo and Sam are thrilled because they're going to the premiere of Galaxy Revengers Part 2 - the most amazing superhero movie of all time - but Mo's excitement cools when his father, the Mayor, enlists him for a celebrity photoshoot in the countryside. The only way that Mo can attend the shoot and get back in time for the movie premiere is to ask for the power of teleportation - to make sure everything works according to plan, Mo drags his half-sister along without asking.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam bets JC that her hamster Hammy can do the same trick as the most popular animal on the internet and agrees to produce a video before the end of the day to prove it - when her initial attempts to train Hammy fail, she asks the Sceptre for the power to communicate with animals, but with only half of the power, Sam can't help behaving just like whatever animal she looks at in the eye, and the same goes for Mo, who starts acting like a small menagerie on his own too!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. To raise awareness of local squirrels' cavity problems, Sam wants to gather as many people as possible for a demonstration, a 'perch-in' in the trees in front of the town hall. She asks the Sceptre for the power to be super-persuasive, but the power works in reverse and Sam is only persuasive when she turns her back - when she faces people, no-one pays any attention to her! Their frustration boils over, causing them both to crash and the Demon Bull family to take the lead - when this happens, Mei and MK work together in order to create a new race car and win the race.

programme.title: LEGO Marvel Avengers: Climate Conundrum
programme.desc: Animated series based on the Marvel superheroes team. With the world's weather out of control, the Avengers must break into teams and trek across the globe to shut down the network of Weather Towers that are now under the control of Red Skull. It's a high-stakes adventure with Captain America and War Machine in the desert - with the help of Black Panther and Thor - Iron Man and Justin Hammer in the jungle, and Black Widow, Hulk and Hawkeye in America's farmland.

programme.title: Overlord and the Underwoods

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Game show that sees teenage presenter Danny Murphy take on some of the craziest dares, from rock climbing to racing a hovercraft! In this episode, Danny experiences the thrill of a flying trapeze, but can he catch the bar and secure a win as the Dare Master?

programme.title: Drop Dead Weird
programme.desc: Paranormal comedy following an Australian family whose members move to the village of Tubbershandy in Ireland. There's a strange bug going around the village

programme.title: Makeaway Takeaway
programme.desc: A comedy arts and crafts show for six to 11-year-olds and presented by comedian Bec Hill. Bec wants to help Makeaway Takeaway go viral on the Internet, but can she come up with something unique to spread the word? She has an idea for a technique that's 'un-fork-getable' and helps a customer make a 'Sloth Bag' for her up and coming sleepover - Bec also delivers an awesome 'Sweet Dispenser' with just three ingredients and some crafty recycling, and a circus instructor gets a surprise from Bec too!

programme.title: Ted's Top Ten
programme.desc: Comedy series following the misadventures of Ted and his school friends and family. Ted has been putting off completing his science project - a mock-up of a volcano - while Jai is ready to erupt himself at having to ride a kids' Spiderman bike and desperate to upgrade. Ted feigns illness to fool Lani and buy himself more time to complete the project, while Stu is genuinely sick and not helped by the fact that Bodhi secretly brings a dog home who proceeds to torment him in his fevered state.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.desc: Animated comedy featuring two trouble-making young friends who re-imagine their grumpy headmaster as a superhero looking to fight crime and save their city. The boys want to go on a fun scavenger hunt, so Krupp sends them on a wild goose chase to find the egg of a Barfilisk - a creature that causes kids to barf rainbows - which George and Harold made up! Naturally, Melvin creates a machine that makes a real Barfilisk - and that then escapes...

Mo fears being forced to take singing lessons with Amber if he fails Mr Brick's mystery test, and with the grades that he usually gets, he definitely won't be able to avoid it! He asks the Sceptre for the power to see into the future so he can find out what the subject of the test will be ahead of time, but when Sam discovers that Mo has essentially asked for the power to cheat, she vows to stop him from carrying out his plan but then has a strange vision...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes

Sam keeps the crystal in her school locker because she doesn't trust her clumsy half-brother Mo with it, but when Sam loses the crystal after a mishap and it gets stuck inside John-Cedrick's locker, Sam is forced to ask for the power to go through walls so that she can recover the crystal undetected and avoid embarrassment.

programme.title: Stephen Fry: Willem & Frieda - Defying the Nazis
programme.desc: The actor and writer visits Amsterdam to learn how, during the occupation of the Netherlands in the Second World War, painter Willem Arondeus and cellist Frieda Belinfante, used their artistic skills to forge identity cards that saved thousands of Jews from the death camps. The Nazis exploited the fact that Holland had the most sophisticated identity card system in the world. Each card they issued had a duplicate stored in the Amsterdam Central Records Office to prevent forgery. Willem led a daring raid to destroy the duplicate cards. Fry also discovers why this story has remained largely hidden to this day

programme.title: 5 News Update

programme.title: The Girl in the Box: The Kidnapping of Stephanie Slater
programme.desc: Part one of two. The story of how, following the kidnap of 25-year-old Stephanie Slater in 1992, extortionist and murderer Michael Sams attempted to evade a huge police operation. The first episode looks back at estate agent Stephanie's abduction at knife point in Birmingham at the hands of Michael Sams, who posed as a house buyer. Contacting her employer, Sams demanded a ¬£175,000 ransom and threatened her life if the police are involved

programme.title: Where is Suzy Lamplugh?
programme.desc: Examining the case surrounding Suzy Lamplugh's disappearance in 1986, tracing the dramatic twists and turns of the case across more than three decades. The programme explores what went wrong with the original investigation, and also draws upon the police's reinvestigation of the case, and follows the emergence of a prime suspect in Suzy's murder

programme.title: 5 Mistakes That Caught a Killer
programme.desc: The case of serial killer Harold Shipman, the doctor who in the year 2000 was convicted of murdering 15 of his patients by injecting them with diamorphine - but is believed to have been responsible for the deaths of more than 200 people. This documentary reveals the string of mistakes that led to his arrest

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: Into the Grand Canyon with Nick Knowles
programme.desc: Part one of two. The presenter adventures through the perilous Grand Canyon, zip-lining over it and battling vertigo to examine the mile-deep chasm from every vantage point. Nick exchanges gifts with the Hualapai tribe whose ancestors used to roam the Canyon, explores the caves 21 storeys below the surface, and takes part in a project to restore the region's endangered condor population

programme.title: Anorexic
programme.desc: Through observational filming, candid interviews and intimate, self-filmed diaries, cameras reveal the ongoing story of three young women caught in the grip of anorexia, and the families fighting to save their lives. Among those featured is 19-year-old Lottie, who has suffered with anorexia for more than five years, and was hospitalised at the age of 16

programme.title: A&E After Dark
